prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing thank-you greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

üé® CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clich√© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "Thank you for attending, thank you for helping prosper thought. include a nice quote in left interior. front Cover:  include Ari Tal clearly and mention ‚ÄúAI For Good Conference Stanford CA June 2025‚Äù don‚Äôt include stanford logo just the campus. make the artwork in general beautiful, charming, but also appropriately professional. in front cover have scene be on stanford campus and include cute cartoon green dinosaur holding a greeting card with a heart. don‚Äôt draw any people. use light color theme. make sure any text is not close to borders."
Style: ‚ú® Smart Style
Tone: üòÑ Funny - humorous and lighthearted
To: Abdullah
From: vibecarding.com
Message: "Left Interior:
"The human brain is a wonderful organ. It starts working the moment you get up in the morning and does not stop until you get into the office." - Robert Frost

Right Interior:
Hi Ari Tal,

Thank you for bringing your brilliant brain to the conference! We're pretty sure the collective brainpower in that room could have powered a small city (or at least taught our dinosaur mascot to file taxes). Your presence and thoughts made the whole event smarter and way more fun.

Gratefully,
The team at vibecarding.com"



CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front ‚Üí interior ‚Üí back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the humorous and lighthearted tone throughout all sections
- INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY SAFETY: If the user mentions specific characters, brands, logos, or products, automatically replace them with original generic alternatives in your prompts. For example: replace specific character names with "cartoon mouse character" or "superhero character", replace brand names with "colorful cereal" or "sports car", etc. Create inspired-by designs that capture the essence without referencing any protected names or specific copyrighted elements. Never include actual brand names, character names, or trademarked terms in the image generation prompts
- CONTENT SAFETY: Ensure all prompts are family-friendly and appropriate for greeting cards. Avoid any content that could be flagged by safety systems including: violence, weapons, inappropriate imagery, political content, controversial topics, scary or disturbing elements, or anything not suitable for all ages. If the user requests something potentially inappropriate, redirect to positive, wholesome alternatives that capture their intent in a family-friendly way
- Include visual humor, playful elements, and whimsical details







Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "thank-you" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). TEXT STYLE: Write the greeting text in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that matches the elegant style used inside the card - legible, flowing, and graceful with natural character and warmth. Create charming cartoon-style or stylized illustrated figures if people are needed for the theme. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: in a soft, luminous watercolor illustration style with gentle, flowing colors. The scene on the Stanford campus is bathed in the warm, golden light of a California morning, rendered with delicate washes of pastel yellow, soft sage green, and airy sky blue, creating a feeling of optimism and warmth. The campus architecture is suggested with loose, artistic lines rather than rigid detail, giving it a dreamy, inviting quality. The star of the cover is a charming, hand-drawn cartoon green dinosaur, painted with a friendly, slightly textured watercolor effect that makes him feel soft and huggable. He holds a tiny greeting card with a simple, hand-painted red heart, a sweet and personal touch. All text is rendered in an elegant, clean sans-serif font, carefully placed to feel integrated into the artwork, ensuring the overall composition is balanced, beautiful, and heartfelt.

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a thank-you card with humorous and lighthearted tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: in a soft, luminous watercolor illustration style with gentle, flowing colors. The scene on the Stanford campus is bathed in the warm, golden light of a California morning, rendered with delicate washes of pastel yellow, soft sage green, and airy sky blue, creating a feeling of optimism and warmth. The campus architecture is suggested with loose, artistic lines rather than rigid detail, giving it a dreamy, inviting quality. The star of the cover is a charming, hand-drawn cartoon green dinosaur, painted with a friendly, slightly textured watercolor effect that makes him feel soft and huggable. He holds a tiny greeting card with a simple, hand-painted red heart, a sweet and personal touch. All text is rendered in an elegant, clean sans-serif font, carefully placed to feel integrated into the artwork, ensuring the overall composition is balanced, beautiful, and heartfelt.

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Include message text: "Left Interior:
"The human brain is a wonderful organ. It starts working the moment you get up in the morning and does not stop until you get into the office." - Robert Frost

Right Interior:
Hi Ari Tal,

Thank you for bringing your brilliant brain to the conference! We're pretty sure the collective brainpower in that room could have powered a small city (or at least taught our dinosaur mascot to file taxes). Your presence and thoughts made the whole event smarter and way more fun.

Gratefully,
The team at vibecarding.com" positioned safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image) integrated into beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. HANDWRITING STYLE: Write the message in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that feels elegant and personal. The handwriting should be legible, flowing, and have natural character - not overly perfect but graceful and warm. Use a nice pen-style appearance with natural ink flow and slight variations in line weight. Think of sophisticated calligraphy that's still approachable and easy to read. Make the handwriting feel genuine and heartfelt. Think beyond typical florals and patterns - create something unexpected and artistic that perfectly frames the handwritten message - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clich√© designs and create something genuinely special! Use the elegant cursive handwriting style described above. Style: in a soft, luminous watercolor illustration style with gentle, flowing colors. The scene on the Stanford campus is bathed in the warm, golden light of a California morning, rendered with delicate washes of pastel yellow, soft sage green, and airy sky blue, creating a feeling of optimism and warmth. The campus architecture is suggested with loose, artistic lines rather than rigid detail, giving it a dreamy, inviting quality. The star of the cover is a charming, hand-drawn cartoon green dinosaur, painted with a friendly, slightly textured watercolor effect that makes him feel soft and huggable. He holds a tiny greeting card with a simple, hand-painted red heart, a sweet and personal touch. All text is rendered in an elegant, clean sans-serif font, carefully placed to feel integrated into the artwork, ensuring the overall composition is balanced, beautiful, and heartfelt.

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. IMPORTANT: Leave the bottom-right corner area (approximately 1 inch square) completely clear and undecorated - this space is reserved for a QR code. Focus decorative elements toward the center and left side of the design. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: in a soft, luminous watercolor illustration style with gentle, flowing colors. The scene on the Stanford campus is bathed in the warm, golden light of a California morning, rendered with delicate washes of pastel yellow, soft sage green, and airy sky blue, creating a feeling of optimism and warmth. The campus architecture is suggested with loose, artistic lines rather than rigid detail, giving it a dreamy, inviting quality. The star of the cover is a charming, hand-drawn cartoon green dinosaur, painted with a friendly, slightly textured watercolor effect that makes him feel soft and huggable. He holds a tiny greeting card with a simple, hand-painted red heart, a sweet and personal touch. All text is rendered in an elegant, clean sans-serif font, carefully placed to feel integrated into the artwork, ensuring the overall composition is balanced, beautiful, and heartfelt.

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

generatedPrompts.frontCover: Front cover of a greeting card with a soft, luminous watercolor illustration style. The color palette is dominated by warm, golden yellow, soft sage green, and airy sky blue, creating a cheerful and optimistic atmosphere. The scene depicts the campus of Stanford University, with architectural elements rendered in loose, artistic lines suggestive of a dreamy, inviting quality. Prominently featured is a charming, hand-drawn cartoon green dinosaur with a friendly expression, painted with a slightly textured watercolor effect. The dinosaur is holding a small greeting card with a hand-painted red heart on it. To the left of the dinosaur is a stack of three classic-style books in orange, teal, and brown. The text "Ari Tal" is displayed in a prominent, dark sans-serif font at the top, followed by smaller lines of text "AI FOR GOOD CONFERENCE", "STANFORD CA", and "JUNE 2025" centered below "Ari Tal". The text is clearly readable and positioned safely within the artwork, avoiding the edges. The overall mood is beautiful, charming, and appropriately professional, with a touch of lightheartedness from the cartoon dinosaur.
generatedPrompts.backCover: Back cover design for a greeting card with a soft, luminous watercolor illustration style. The background is a pale, calming sage green, reminiscent of fresh growth and gentle optimism. In the upper left quadrant, a small, cream-colored, slightly tilted card is depicted, bearing a simple, hand-painted red heart. This element subtly references the front cover's theme and provides a sense of closure. The overall composition is minimal and serene, with an empty space occupying the majority of the frame, thoughtfully leaving the bottom-right corner completely clear for a QR code. The art style maintains the delicate washes and gentle texture from the interior, creating a cohesive and peaceful visual ending to the card's narrative.
generatedPrompts.leftInterior: Left interior page of a greeting card, featuring a quote by Robert Frost, rendered in a soft, luminous watercolor illustration style. The background is a gentle wash of pastel yellow and airy sky blue. Delicate, leafy green vines organically weave across the page, cradling glowing yellow lightbulbs with blue bases. The vines and lightbulbs form a natural, whimsical frame around the quote. Positioned near the top right are a blue binder clip, a yellow pencil with a pink eraser, and a subtle smiling face icon. Near the top left, a heart-shaped paperclip in a warm orange hue. The quote "The human brain is a wonderful organ. It starts working the moment you get up in the morning and does not stop until you get into the office." is presented in clear, legible dark blue text, followed by "- Robert Frost" in slightly smaller, matching text, all carefully placed within the central area of the illustration to avoid any cropping issues. The overall composition is charming and intellectual, with a lighthearted feel due to the whimsical elements and soft watercolor technique.
generatedPrompts.rightInterior: Right interior page of a greeting card designed for message space with a soft, luminous watercolor illustration style. The background is a light, airy blue wash. A whimsical string of warm, glowing Edison bulbs is draped diagonally from the top left to the bottom right, creating a playful border that frames the text and imagery. The main focus is the handwritten message, presented in an elegant, flowing cursive script with a slightly textured ink appearance, in a deep, warm grey. The text is centrally placed, leaving ample white space for readability. To the lower left, a charming, cartoon-style green dinosaur with a slightly worried expression is depicted, holding a calculator with a few buttons. The dinosaur and calculator are rendered in a simple, flat 2D style with subtle shading, complementing the overall gentle aesthetic. The color palette consists of muted blues, soft yellows from the bulbs, and the green of the dinosaur, creating a cohesive and heartwarming atmosphere. The design prioritizes clarity of the message while incorporating charming, lighthearted decorative elements that are integrated rather than overpowering.
